Description: Jar of heavy, squat form: this intact translucent grey-blue glass jar has a matt finish and two monochrome handles. The festoon decorations on both the neck and body are turquoise-blue with matt surfaces.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 94, pl. VIII, 18; J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, p. 169, pl. on p. 169.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.169)
Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.26, pp.30-31)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
